title: Adcs have an easier time getting to 40% cdr than mages
body:
There's a lot of... abusable things this preseason like keystones and etc, but I think the new Essence Reaver is just too good.

It honestly offers too many stats for it's cost when you factor in the free cdr you get from crit.

Yes, Essence Reaver was an awful item before that needed to be reworked but now it's good to the point of being overloaded.

I think Mages should get a third 20% CDR item with more offensive and less defensive or niche stats. Currently all they have is Athene's and Morellonomicon. Nashor's is an option as well but it's more of a niche item for auto-attack-based AP champions. 

Maybe they can add 20% CDR to Abyssal Scepter? Throw Fiendish Codex into the build path, buff the AP it gives to +80, maybe lower the MR it gives if it becomes too efficient for AP tanks. This would put it about on the level of at least Black Cleaver, giving useful offensive stats and effects while also giving useful defensive stats. This would probably bump its price up to about 3150, but that'd still be cheaper than BC by 350 gold.

You're glaring over the fact that CDR needs to be tied to mana, or else it becomes too powerful on manaless champions.

We need to go into the direction of something like Lost Chapter, not give CDR anywhere.

That is true, I hadn't thought about that (and that does explain why so many CDR items also give mana regen).

In that case, I think it might be prudent to add Lost Chapter back in, and perhaps one of the three books it builds into. Probably Netherstride Grimoire as it's the least niche of the three and I think all mages can benefit from the extra MS, though Rite of Ruin wouldn't be bad either, if not maybe a bit tweaked.

To the guys who see you can buy {{item:3165}} + {{item:3174}}  to get 40% CDR at a not too high of a price... well, you are right about that.
However, the real problem is another one, in my opinion, and i will point it out clearly:
An ADC buys {{item:3508}}  and then get a lot of CDR simply buying other items that are optimal and he would want anyway.
On the other hand, an AP champion can surely buy  {{item:3165}} + {{item:3174}}, BUT doing so it's not optimal, because you are spending gold to get more mana reg than you want, and giving up AP, which means damage, to get that 40% CDR. You can also go for other items, like {{item:3158}} , which is very good, by the way. But then you are giving up on the 15 Magic penetration from {{item:3020}} . Every choice AP mages can do to get more than 20%  force them to give up on something. That's not wrong, really. It's just that people get annoyed by the fact that on the other hand an ADC can get extra CDR while buying items that he would want anyway because they are optimal.



**TL,DR**: the problem is not about being able to reach high CDR: what peope are getting annoyed by is the fact that AP champions need to give up on some usefull stats to get more than 20% CDR (like more AP if you get morello + athene, or magic penetration if you get lucidity), while ADCs have an item that let them have a lot of CDR while buying optimal items, thus not giving up on anything, really.

Equipment is going to cost. But, if the items you were going to build anyway also give extra stats now combined with other eq/masteries, then I think you can see why they say it is "like" free stats. It is. ER gives good damage and crit and cdr and mana return, other adc items that they would also build increases the cdr. They might as well give it scaling cdr to 30 on a time scale, it would essentially amount to the same thing on an adc. Remember that with the new masteries, crit is also giving great lifesteal and some AS as well. So building crit+AS items which adcs do anyway, give them extra lifesteal, AS, and with ER they get extra cdr as well. IE, ER, and then 2 of the other AS+crit items to bring an adc to the extra 20 AS, 100 percent crit and lifesteal on every hit. I don't even bother getting BT anymore. There is little point in giving up damage for LS when you get it already from building more damage.

Compare that with mages who have to choose between damage/cdr and don't get 15 percent spell vamp from building what they were going to build anyway. Or tanks choosing to build between hps and resists and sustain. They take a hit by making choices in their builds that adcs no longer have to make. ADCs get to build along a pure damage path and still get everything else on top of it. It feels a little like injury after insults after reduction in mana, cdr items, armor items.

I guess in that regard, mages also get "free" stats from deathcap, since it gives you AP for building what you were going to build anyway, AP.

I mean, it seems like you're upset that 
1. An ADC can get a bunch of useful stats while pursuing what they really want, crit, and
2. There doesn't seem to be any tradeoff for building essence reaver.

Well the first thing is just par the course for league of legends. If you're a mage and you just want a ton of AP, you might build {{item:3089}} {{item:3003}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3027}} . Awesome, you buit 400 AP, and on the way you also picked up almost 1k health and an equally massive mana shield from {{item:3040}} .
So yeah, most big items in this game give "free stats".

As far as there being no tradeoff for essence reaver, or never wanting to buy Lifesteal.
I'd say you definitely want to buy lifesteal. 15% lifesteal on critical strikes every two seconds, doesn't compare to 20% lifesteal on every single attack, or even Death's dance spellvamp effect and damage mitigating passive. If you want survivability, building lifesteal items will, mathematically and in personal experience, beat relying on that single mastery. Heaven forbid you take deathfire's touch (which caster AD's will sometimes do)

And as for being no tradeoff's for essence reaver; Kog'maw and Vayne would probably prefer to rush Bortk first. Tristana or Graves would probably prefer to have Infinity Edge. Certainly Essence reaver is a good item, and CDR is one of those things that isn't BAD on any champion. But then again, neither is HP, and yet I don't see Velkoz buying Warmogs.

Mercurial Scimitar is too good compared to BT is the big problem I have with BT. BT got hit too hard with the cost increases and is really just subpar to the Scimitar. Yeah you lose the shield but instead you get a "better than cleanse" cleanse WITH a ms boost and a good chunk of MR while also being an a better build path since you do not have to fork over like 1.3k for a recipe (I don't know the cost off the top of my head).
